dublin_core.dcvalue: In this paper we combine the most complete record of daily mobility based on large scale mobile phone data with detailed Geographic Information System GIS data uncovering previously hidden patterns in urban road usage We find that the major usage of each road segment can be traced to its own surprisingly few driver sources Based on this finding we propose a network of road usage by defining a bipartite network framework demonstrating that in contrast to traditional approaches which define road importance solely by topological measures the role of a road segment depends on both its betweeness and its degree in the road usage network Moreover our ability to pinpoint the few driver sources contributing to the major traffic flow allows us to create a strategy that achieves a significant reduction of the travel time across the entire road system compared to a benchmark approach
Understanding road usage patterns in urban areas.
